testCase: contract MaliciousReceiver { function execute(bytes memory _data) public { revert(); } } // Call MaliciousReceiver's execute() method, which reverts.
description: The contract uses the low-level call method to invoke another contract without checking if the call was successful. If the called contract reverts, it can cause unexpected behavior in the calling contract, such as failing to update its state variables correctly and consuming gas, leading to potential denial of service (DoS) attacks.
fixedLines: c.call(abi.encodeWithSignature("execute(bytes)", _data)); // consider using require(c.call(...)) to handle failures.
